steps.title: Take the sugar and put it into a pot.
steps.content: Take the sugar and put it into a pot.

steps.title: Pour in some water.
steps.content: Pour in some water. About enough to cover the sugar

steps.title: Turn the stove top onto high so the water starts to boil.
steps.content: Turn the stove top onto high so the water starts to boil.

steps.title: Start stirring the sugar right away to keep it from sticking to the bottom and turning into toffee.
steps.content: Start stirring the sugar right away to keep it from sticking to the bottom and turning into toffee.

steps.title: Keep stirring and adding water until the sugar and water mixture turns into a Brown syrupy mixture.
steps.content: Keep stirring and adding water until the sugar and water mixture turns into a Brown syrupy mixture. What you have now made is a light caramel syrup.

steps.title: Add the butter and stir it into the syrup.
steps.content: Add the butter and stir it into the syrup. Also add a shot of cream and a teaspoon of vanilla.

steps.title: Put back onto the stove but heat it until it's at the "soft crack" stage.
steps.content: Put back onto the stove but heat it until it's at the "soft crack" stage. The soft crack stage is about 270-290°F or 132-143°C. You should have a concentration of about 95% sugar. If you heat it too long then it will turn into toffee.

steps.title: Keep heating until it is thick but still fluid.
steps.content: Keep heating until it is thick but still fluid.

steps.title: Immediately pour it into a bowl or container.
steps.content: Immediately pour it into a bowl or container. Make sure you keep stirring it otherwise it will thicken and become a toffee like substance.

steps.title: Enjoy the great taste of butterscotch.
steps.content: Enjoy the great taste of butterscotch.
